A variety of approaches and strategies to improve the biological potencies of these entities were employed including (1) the use of novel carbonate-containing disulfide linkers to connect the degraders to the antibodies, (2) the introduction of “chemical handles” into the degraders to enable antibody attachment with well-precedented linkers, and (3) the use of SPR techniques to assess the compound degradation potential via BRD4–VHL ternary complex quantitation. As multiple interdependent parameters likely contributed to the biological outcomes associated with the new ADCs, it was often difficult to isolate and study a given chimeric degrader or conjugate property during the course of this work. The reported ability of BRD4 degradation to reduce STEAP1 expression levels (which we did not confirm in our studies) may also have contributed to the biological outcomes.(7) The described process is therefore best described as semiempirical in nature.
    In spite of these challenges, the results contained in this initial disclosure provided several key conclusions that heavily influenced the next phase of this research.(17) Intracellular quantitation of one particular payload (compound 8) following antibody-mediated delivery indicated that the amounts of the released chimeric degrader were insufficient to drive antiproliferation effects in the cells. The same experiments also demonstrated that increased antibody loading of the payload (i.e., higher DAR value) increased the amounts of the chimeric degrader 8 delivered to the cells. Head-to-head comparison of two DAR2 conjugates with their DAR6 counterparts confirmed the ability of the higher-DAR conjugates to exhibit stronger BRD4 degradation activities in the PC3-S1 experiments (Table 2; STEAP1–3a and STEAP1–8a conjugates). An objective of conjugating more potent BRD4 degraders to the antibodies with a preference for DAR6 drug loading was therefore carried into the next phase of our research.
    The data contained in this report also indicated that conjugates prepared using cleavable peptidomimetic or disulfide-based linkers and maleimide or disulfide-derived antibody attachment chemistries exhibited acceptable in vivo stability properties. Such linking and attachment approaches were therefore retained in our subsequent studies. However, the results from this phase of our experiments also indicated that no additional benefits were achieved through the use of noncleavable linkers, and such entities were therefore not explored in our follow-on efforts. In addition, the data demonstrated that introduction of the “chemical handles” into the chimeric degraders for antibody attachment purposes often impaired the biological potencies of the resulting molecules relative to the unmodified compounds. This observation underscored the need to improve the intrinsic activities of the chimeric molecules that were conjugated and also prioritized the use of linkers that did not require the modified chemical handles. Both of these strategies were pursued in the next phase of this research.
    Most importantly, as depicted in the analysis presented in Figure 10, the collective results clearly indicated the ability of the chimeric degrader antibody-conjugates to consistently exhibit antigen-dependent BRD4 degradation effects in the targeted PC3-S1 cells. This observation indicated that the described conjugates functioned as selective delivery agents in the in vitro experiments and, coupled with their favorable in vivo performance, provided good confidence to continue the improvement of such entities with the goal of achieving in vivo antitumor activity. The results from these continued studies, including demonstration of the sought-after in vivo antitumor efficacy, are described in a second manuscript, which immediately follows this report in this issue of the journal.(17)

    Experimental Section

    ARTICLE SECTIONS
    Jump To

    General Chemistry Methods

    Unless otherwise indicated, all reagents and solvents were purchased from commercial sources and were used without further purification. Moisture- or oxygen-sensitive reactions were conducted under an atmosphere of argon or nitrogen gas. Unless otherwise stated, 1H NMR spectra were recorded at 300 or 400 MHz using Varian or Bruker instruments operating at the indicated frequencies. Chemical shifts are expressed in parts per million (ppm) (δ) relative to an internal standard; tetramethylsilane (ppm = 0.00). The following abbreviations are used: br, broad signal; s, singlet; d, doublet; dd, doublet of doublets; t, triplet; q, quartet; p, pentet; m, multiplet. Purification by silica gel chromatography was carried out using Biotage systems with prepacked cartridges. Analytical LCMS methods are provided in the Supporting Information (Table S5). Chemical purities were ≥95% for all final compounds as assessed by LCMS analysis at UV 220 and 254 nm.

    (S)-2-(4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetic Acid (13)

    To a solution of compound 1(3) (1000 mg, 2.19 mmol) in DCM (30 mL) was added TFA (5.0 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated to give compound 13 (850 mg, 97% yield) as a yellow solid. This material was used without additional purification in the next step. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.84 min, m/z = 401.0 [M + H]+.

    2-(2-(2-(2-Aminoethoxy)ethoxy)ethoxy)acetic Acid (15)

    A solution of HCl (1.55 mL, 4 M in EtOAc) was slowly added to a solution of 2-[2-[2-[2-(tert-butoxycarbonylamino)ethoxy]ethoxy]ethoxy]acetic acid 14 (950 mg, 3.09 mmol) in DCM (2 mL) at 23 °C. The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h whereupon thin-layer chromatography (TLC) analysis showed the starting material was consumed (10% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.3). The mixture was concentrated in vacuo to give compound 15 (HCl salt; 750 mg, 100%) as a colorless oil. This material was used without additional purification in the next step.

    (S)-1-(4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-2-oxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3-azatetradecan-14-oic Acid (16)

    A solution of DCC (453 mg, 2.2 mmol) and compound 13 (800 mg, 2 mmol), N-hydroxysuccinimide (253 mg, 2.2 mmol), and DIEA (258 mg, 2.0 mmol) in THF (10 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h. The reaction mixture was filtered, and the filtrate was concentrated to give the crude N-hydroxysuccinimide ester (structure not shown; 990 mg, 100%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.83 min, m/z = 498.0 [M + H]+. A solution of this crude material (990 mg, 1.99 mmol), compound 15 (727 mg, 2.98 mmol), and DIEA (257 mg, 1.99 mmol) in DMF (15 mL) was stirred at 17 °C for 6 h. The reaction mixture was concentrated to dryness, and the residue was purified by reverse-phase chromatography (MeCN 32–52/0.225% TFA in H2O) to afford compound 16 (450 mg, 38%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.81 min, m/z = 590.1 [M + H]+.

    2-(((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)acetic Acid (18)

    NaH (226 mg, 60% in mineral oil, 5.65 mmol) was suspended in THF (4 mL), and a solution of compound 17(56) (300 mg, 0.57 mmol) in THF (3 mL) was added dropwise at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h; then, a solution of 2-bromoacetic acid (118 mg, 0.85 mmol) in THF (3 mL) was added. The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then was quenched with H2O (10 mL) and extracted with EtOAc (10 mL). The aqueous layer was acidified with 2 M HCl to pH = 3 and then extracted with 10% MeOH in DCM (2 × 10 mL). The DCM layers were dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated to give the crude product 18 (190 mg, 57%) as a brown oil. This material was used in the next step without additional purification. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.74 min, m/z = 589.1 [M + H]+.

    2-(((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)acetic Acid (19)

    To a solution of compound 18 (190 mg, 0.36 mmol) in DCM (5 mL) was added 4 M HCl in EtOAc (5 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then concentrated to give the crude amine product (HCl salt, not shown; 120 mg, 71%) as a gray solid. A solution of compound 16 (152 mg, 0.26 mmol), DIEA (66 mg, 0.51 mmol), and HATU (98 mg, 0.26 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (3 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 15 min; then, the crude amine HCl salt (90 mg, 0.17 mmol) was added. The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and was filtered. The filtrate was purified by reverse-phase HPLC (MeCN 40–60/0.225% formic acid (FA) in H2O) to afford compound 19 (35 mg, 19%) as a gray solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.88 min, m/z = 1060.7 [M + H]+.

    4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl ((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)methyl)carbamate (3a)

    Triethylamine (8.6 mg, 0.08 mmol) was added to a solution of compound 19 (30 mg, 0.03 mmol) and DPPA (12 mg, 0.04 mmol) in DMF (2 mL). The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then partitioned between H2O (5 mL) and toluene (2 × 3 mL). The combined organic layers were sequentially dried over Na2SO4 and 4 Å molecular sieves and were then used in the next step. To this solution was added a solution of compound 20(57) (16 mg, 0.03 mmol) in DMF (2 mL), followed by addition of dibutyltin dilaurate (1.75 mg, 0.003 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 80 °C for 1 h and then cooled to 23 °C and filtered. The filtrate was concentrated and the residue was purified by prep-TLC (10% of MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.3) to afford compound 3a (2.5 mg, 5.6%) as a gray solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.76 min, m/z = 815.3 [M/2 + H]+; LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 4.03 min, m/z = 815.3 [M/2 + H]+.

    (R)-S-(1-Hydroxypropan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (21)

    Sodium methanesulfinate (415 mg, 4.06 mmol) and iodine (515 mg, 2.03 mmol) were added sequentially to a solution of (R)-2-((5-nitropyridin-2-yl)disulfanyl)propan-1-ol(58) (500 mg, 2.03 mmol) in DCM (10 mL) at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at 40 °C for 12 h and then cooled to 23 °C and filtered. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo and the residue was purified by prep-TLC (33% EtOAc in petroleum ether) to give compound 21 (234 mg, 68%) as a yellow oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 3.90–3.85 (m, 1H), 3.74–3.67 (m, 2H), 3.40 (s, 3H), 1.45 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 3H).

    S-(1-Hydroxy-2-methylpropan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (22)

    Sodium methanesulfinate (784 mg, 7.68 mmol) and iodine (975 mg, 3.84 mmol) were added sequentially to a solution of 2-methyl-2-((5-nitropyridin-2-yl)disulfanyl)propan-1-ol(58) (1000 mg, 3.84 mmol) in DCM (20 mL) at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at 40 °C for 24 h and then cooled to 23 °C and filtered. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo and the residue was purified by prep-TLC (33% EtOAc in petroleum ether) to give compound 22 (118 mg, 17%) as a yellow oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6) δ 3.54 (s, 2H), 3.50 (s, 3H), 1.44 (s, 6H).

    S-(3-Hydroxybutan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (23)

    To a solution of 3-mercaptobutan-2-ol (2000 mg, 18.8 mmol) in anhydrous DCM (40 mL) was added MnO2 (2460 mg, 28.3 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h whereupon TLC analysis (33% EtOAc in petroleum ether, Rf = 0.4) showed that a new spot was formed and the starting material was consumed. The mixture was filtered, and the filtrate was concentrated in vacuo to afford 3,3′-disulfanediylbis(butan-2-ol) (1:1 mixture of diastereomers; 1970 mg, 99%) as a colorless oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 4.13–4.08 and 3.83–3.78 (m, 2H), 2.94–2.91 and 2.82–2.78 (m, 2H), 2.38–2.26 and 2.14–2.02 (m, 2H), 1.35–1.22 (m, 12H). To a solution of crude 3,3′-disulfanediylbis(butan-2-ol) (1970 mg, 9.36 mmol) in anhydrous DCM (50 mL) were added sodium methanesulfinate (1910 mg, 18.7 mmol) and iodine (2380 mg, 9.36 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred in the dark at 23 °C for 1 day and then filtered. The filtrate was concentrated and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica eluting with 0–5% MeOH in DCM to afford compound 23 (1:1 mixture of diastereomers; 1200 mg, 70%) as a pale-yellow oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 4.13–4.11 and 3.96–3.93 (m, 1H), 3.77–3.73 and 3.51–3.47 (m, 1H), 3.42 and 3.39 (s, 3H), 2.04 and 1.96 (brs, 1H), 1.53 and 1.42 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 3H), 1.33 and 1.23 (d, J = 6.0 Hz, 3H).

    S-((R)-1-(((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)carbonyl)oxy)propan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (24)

    To a 15 °C solution of triphosgene (70 mg, 0.23 mmol) in DCM (2 mL) was added a solution of pyridine (37 mg, 0.47 mmol) and compound 21 (80 mg, 0.47 mmol) in DCM (2 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred at 15 °C for 30 min and then concentrated to dryness. The crude material thus obtained was diluted with DCM (4 mL) and a solution of Et3N (38 mg, 0.38 mmol), and compound 17(56) (100 mg, 0.19 mmol) in DCM (2 mL) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 15 °C for 2 h and then concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography eluting with 10% MeOH in DCM to give compound 24 (86 mg, 32%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB,1.5 min): RT = 0.83 min, m/z = 727.1 [M + H]+.

    S-((R)-1-(((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)carbonyl)oxy)propan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (3b)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 24 (86 mg, 0.12 mmol) in HFIP (2 mL) was added TFA (0.1 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated in vacuo to give the crude TFA salt (not shown, 76 mg, 87%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.61 min, m/z = 627.0 [M + H]+. A mixture of compound 16 (60 mg, 0.08 mmol), DIEA (31 mg, 0.24 mmol), and HATU (40 mg, 0.11 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (5 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 10 min; then, the crude TFA salt (62 mg, 0.11 mmol) was added. The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 46–76/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 3b (17 mg, 17%) as a white solid. LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 4.24 min, m/z = 1198.3 [M + H]+.

    S-(1-(((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)carbonyl)oxy)-2-methylpropan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (25)

    To a 15 °C solution of triphosgene (95 mg, 0.32 mmol) in DCM (2 mL) was added a solution of pyridine (51 mg, 0.64 mmol) and compound 22 (118 mg, 0.64 mmol) in DCM (2 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred at 15 °C for 30 min and then concentrated to dryness. The crude material thus obtained was diluted with DCM (8 mL) and a solution of Et3N (50 mg, 0.49 mmol), and compound 17(56) (130 mg, 0.24 mmol) in DCM (2 mL) was added. The formed mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography eluting with 0–10% MeOH in DCM to give compound 25 (107 mg, 44%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.81 min, m/z = 741.1 [M + H]+.

    S-(1-(((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)carbonyl)oxy)-2-methylpropan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (3c)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 25 (107 mg, 0.14 mmol) in HFIP (1.9 mL) was added TFA (0.1 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated in vacuo to give the corresponding crude TFA salt (not shown, 109 mg, 100%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.63 min, m/z = 641.0 [M + H]+. A solution of compound 16 (60 mg, 0.10 mmol), DIEA (40 mg, 0.31 mmol), and HATU (58 mg, 0.15 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (10 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 10 min, and the crude TFA salt (100 mg, 0.13 mmol) was subsequently added. The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 39–69/0.1% TFA in H2O) to give compound 3c (43 mg, 33%) as a white solid. LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 4.31 min, m/z = 1212.6 [M + H]+.

    S-(3-(((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)carbonyl)oxy)butan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (26)

    To a mixture of triphosgene (112 mg, 0.38 mmol) and 4 Å molecular sieves (100 mg) in anhydrous DCM (10 mL) was added a solution of compound 23 (139 mg, 0.75 mmol) and pyridine (179 mg, 2.26 mmol) in anhydrous DCM (5 mL) slowly at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 30 min and then concentrated in vacuo. The residue was diluted with anhydrous DCM (15 mL), and Et3N (114 mg, 1.13 mmol) and compound 17(56) (200 mg, 0.38 mmol) were added sequentially. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for another 2 h, diluted with DCM (20 mL), and washed with H2O (3 × 20 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (8% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.6) to afford compound 26 (100 mg, 35%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.88 min, m/z = 763.0 [M + Na]+.

    S-(3-(((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-18-(tert-Butyl)-2,2-dimethyl-4,16-dioxo-3,8,11,14-tetraoxa-5,17-diazanonadecan-19-oyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)carbonyl)oxy)butan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (27)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 26 (90 mg, 0.12 mmol) in HFIP (6.0 mL) was added TFA (0.3 mL). The reaction solution was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated in vacuo to afford the crude TFA salt (not shown, 90 mg, 98%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.74 min, m/z = 641.1 [M + H]+. To a solution of compound 14 (55 mg, 0.18 mmol) in DMF (6 mL) were added DIEA (77 mg, 0.60 mmol) and HATU (91 mg, 0.24 mmol). The resulting solution was stirred at 23 °C for 15 min; then, the crude TFA salt (90 mg, 0.12 mmol) was added. The resulting reaction solution was stirred at 23 °C for 30 min and then concentrated in vacuo to remove the solvent. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (10% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.7) to afford compound 27 (100 mg, 83%) as a white solid. LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 4.03 min, m/z = 952.3 [M + Na]+.

    S-(3-(((((3R,5S)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-5-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-3-yl)oxy)carbonyl)oxy)butan-2-yl)methanesulfonothioate (3d)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 27 (90 mg, 0.10 mmol) in HFIP (7.0 mL) was added TFA (0.35 mL). The reaction solution was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated in vacuo to remove the solvent and provide the crude TFA salt (not shown, 90 mg, 99%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.76 min, m/z = 830.5 [M + H]+. To a solution of compound 13 (57 mg, 0.14 mmol) in DMF (4 mL) were added DIEA (62 mg, 0.48 mmol) and HATU (62 mg, 0.16 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 15 min; then, the crude TFA salt (90 mg, 0.10 mmol) was added. The resulting solution was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (Xtimate C18 150 × 25 mm2 × 5 μm, MeCN 56–66/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 3d (30 mg, 25%) as a white solid. LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 4.33 min, m/z = 1234.7 [M + Na]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6) δ 8.99 (s, 1H), 8.64 (brs, 1H), 8.29 (t, J = 5.6 Hz, 1H), 7.45–7.40 (m, 9H), 5.23 (brs, 1H), 4.98–4.95 (m, 1H), 4.53–4.38 (m, 4H), 4.30–4.24 (m, 1H), 4.12–4.07 (m, 1H), 3.96 (s, 2H), 3.86–3.84 (m, 1H), 3.74–3.71 (m, 1H), 3.59–3.53 (m, 12H), 3.31–3.18 (m, 3H), 2.59 (s, 3H), 2.45 (s, 3H), 2.40 (s, 3H), 2.37–2.33 (m, 1H), 2.17–2.10 (m, 1H), 1.61 (s, 3H), 1.44–1.37 (m, 3H), 1.34–1.25 (m, 3H), 0.95 (s, 9H).

    tert-Butyl (S)-2-(4-(4-Aminophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (28)

    A mixture of compound 1 (300 mg, 0.66 mmol), diphenylmethanimine (178 mg, 0.98 mmol), Pd2(dba)3 (60 mg, 0.07 mmol), S-Phos (27 mg, 0.07 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (642 mg, 1.97 mmol) in toluene (20 mL) was stirred at 110 °C under nitrogen for 16 h. The mixture was cooled to 23 °C and filtered, and the filtrate was concentrated under a vacuum. The residue was purified by flash chromatography on silica gel eluting with 0–100% EtOAc in petroleum ether to afford the coupled imine product (not shown, 350 mg, 60%) as a yellow oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 1.05 min, m/z = 602.2 [M + H]+. A mixture of this material (350 mg, 0.58 mmol) in THF (20 mL) and aqueous HCl (1 M, 5.0 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 3 h. The THF was removed under a vacuum, and the aqueous remainder was basified with saturated aqueous NaHCO3 to pH = 7.0 and extracted with EtOAc (4 × 25 mL). The combined organic layers were dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by chromatography on silica eluting with 0–5% MeOH in DCM to afford compound 28 (250 mg, 95%) as a yellow oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.74 min, m/z = 460.0 [M + Na]+.

    tert-Butyl (S)-2-(2,3,9-Trimethyl-4-(4-(2,2,2-trifluoroacetamido)phenyl)-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (29)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 28 (180 mg, 0.41 mmol) in pyridine (97 mg, 1.23 mmol) was added TFAA (129.6 mg, 0.62 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h. The reaction mixture was diluted with EtOAc (20 mL), and the resulting solution was washed sequentially with H2O (2 × 20 mL) and brine (1 × 20 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (5% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.3) to afford compound 29 (170 mg, 78%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.83 min, m/z = 534.2 [M + H]+.

    (S)-2-(2,3,9-Trimethyl-4-(4-(2,2,2-trifluoroacetamido)phenyl)-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetic Acid (30)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 29 (80 mg, 0.15 mmol) in EtOAc (1 mL) was added 4 N HCl (0.95 mL) in EtOAc. The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 3 h and then concentrated to afford the crude compound 30 (70 mg, 98%) as a yellow oil. This material was used in the next step without additional purification.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-17-((S)-4-(4-Aminophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-2-(tert-butyl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxy-N-(4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)pyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (4)

    A solution of compound 30 (70 mg, 0.15 mmol), DIEA (0.05 mL, 0.29 mmol), and HATU (111 mg, 0.29 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (2.5 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 20 min. Compound 31(59) (100 mg, 0.16 mmol) was then added, and the resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h. The reaction solution was directly purified by flash chromatography eluting with 0–100% EtOAc in petroleum ether to afford the coupled product (not shown, 120 mg, 76%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.69 min, m/z =1101.6 [M + Na]+. This material (120 mg, 0.11 mmol) was dissolved in 1:1 MeOH/THF (3.6 mL), and LiOH·H2O (23 mg, 0.56 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 50 °C for 12 h whereupon LCMS analysis showed good conversion to the desired product. The reaction mixture was cooled to 23 °C and was concentrated. Purification of the residue by prep-HPLC (MeCN 20–50/0.225% FA in H2O) afforded compound 4 (52 mg, 45%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.96 min, m/z = 492.4 [M/2 + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6): 8.97(s, 1H), 8.61 (t, J = 6.0 Hz, 1H), 8.41–8.36 (m, 1H), 7.45–7.42 (m, 2H), 7.41–7.38 (m, 4H), 7.24–7.16 (m, 2H), 6.62 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 1H), 4.58–4.54 (m, 1H), 4.52–4.43 (m, 2H), 4.42–4.40 (m, 2H), 4.39–4.35 (m, 1H), 4.01–3.81 (m, 2H), 3.75–3.69 (m, 2H), 3.68–3.45 (m, 14H), 3.78–3.71 (m, 2H), 2.61 (s, 3H), 2.43 (s, 6H), 2.05–2.03(m, 1H), 1.91–1.88 (m, 1H), 1.71 (s, 3H), 0.94 (s, 9H).

    (9H-Fluoren-9-yl)methyl ((S)-1-((4-((S)-6-((S)-16-((2S,4R)-4-Hydroxy-2-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidine-1-carbonyl)-17,17-dimethyl-2,14-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaoctadecyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-4-yl)phenyl)amino)-1-oxo-5-ureidopentan-2-yl)carbamate (32)

    A mixture of Fmoc-l-Cit-OH (18 mg, 0.05 mmol) and EEDQ (15 mg, 0.06 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 30 min. The resulting mixture was then added to a solution of compound 4 (15 mg, 0.02 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) at 23 °C. The new reaction mixture was stirred at that temperature for 48 h and then filtered. The filtrate was directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 33–63/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 32 (10 mg, 48%) as a white solid. LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 3.70 min, m/z = 682.1 [M/2 + H]+.

    N-(5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)-N-((S)-1-((4-((S)-6-((S)-16-((2S,4R)-4-hydroxy-2-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidine-1-carbonyl)-17,17-dimethyl-2,14-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaoctadecyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-4-yl)phenyl)amino)-1-oxo-5-ureidopentan-2-yl)cyclobutane-1,1-dicarboxamide (4a)

    To a solution of compound 32 (10 mg, 0.01 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) was added piperidine (2.5 mg, 0.03 mmol) at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at that temperature for 2 h and then concentrated. The crude material thus obtained was washed with methyl tert-butyl ether (MTBE) (2 × 2 mL) to give the deprotected product (not shown, 8 mg, 96%) as a gray solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.61 min, m/z = 571.1 [M/2 + H]+. Separately, HATU (6 mg, 0.015 mmol) and DIEA (4 mg, 0.03 mmol) were added to a solution of compound 33(60) (4.5 mg, 0.015 mmol) in DMF (3 mL) at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at that temperature for 10 min, and then, the crude deprotected amine derived above from 32 (8 mg, 0.01 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then partitioned between H2O (5 mL) and EtOAc (10 mL). The organic layer was washed sequentially with H2O (2 × 5 mL) and brine (5 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 31–51/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 4a (2.5 mg, 24%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.66 min, m/z = 716.3 [M/2 + H]+.

    tert-Butyl 2-((S)-4-(4-((((4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl)oxy)carbonyl)amino)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (34)

    To a solution of triphosgene (27 mg, 0.09 mmol) in THF (5 mL) was added a solution of compound 28 (40 mg, 0.09 mmol) in THF (5 mL) at 23 °C under N2. The reaction mixture was stirred at 40 °C for 2 h and then cooled to 23 °C and concentrated. The crude isocyanate thus obtained was dissolved in DCM (5 mL) at 23 °C, and a solution of compound 20 (59 mg, 0.10 mmol) and Et3N (26 mg, 0.26 mmol) in DMF (1 mL) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 4 h and then concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 44–74/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 34 (7.0 mg, 7.8%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.86 min, m/z = 1056.2 [M + Na]+.

    2-((S)-4-(4-((((4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl)oxy)carbonyl)amino)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetic Acid (35)

    A solution of compound 34 (10 mg, 0.01 mmol) in 1:1 TFA/DCM (4 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h. The reaction mixture was then concentrated to give crude compound 35 (9.4 mg, 99%) as a yellow solid. This material was used in the next step without additional purification. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.78 min, m/z = 978.2 [M + H]+.

    4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl (4-((S)-6-((S)-16-((2S,4R)-4-Hydroxy-2-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidine-1-carbonyl)-17,17-dimethyl-2,14-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaoctadecyl)-3,9-dimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-4-yl)phenyl)carbamate (4b)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 35 (9.4 mg, 0.01 mmol) in DMF (5 mL) were added HATU (4.5 mg, 0.01 mmol) and DIEA (3.7 mg, 0.03 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 10 min whereupon compound 31(59) (8.5 mg, 0.01 mmol) was added and stirring was continued at 23 °C for an additional 12 h. The mixture was then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 30–60/0.225% FA in MeCN) to afford compound 4b (1.8 mg, 12%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.82 min, m/z = 790.6 [M/2 + H]+.

    tert-Butyl (S)-2-(4-(4-(3-Aminoprop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (36)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 1 (50 mg, 0.11 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) were added Pd(Cy*Phine)2Cl2 (7.0 mg, 0.01 mmol), Cs2CO3 (107 mg, 0.33 mmol), and propargyl amine (30 mg, 0.55 mmol). The mixture was then stirred at 120 °C in a microwave reactor under N2 for 1 h. The reaction mixture was cooled to 23 °C and filtered, and the filtrate was concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (5% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.4) to give compound 36 (16 mg, 24%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.778 min, m/z = 476.2 [M + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.39 (brs, 4H), 4.56 (t, J = 6.4 Hz, 1H), 3.73 (brs, H), 3.55–3.53 (m, 2H), 2.69 (s, 3H), 2.40 (s, 3H), 1.66 (s, 3H), 1.49 (s, 9H).

    tert-Butyl (S)-2-(4-(4-(3-((((9H-Fluoren-9-yl)methoxy)carbonyl)amino)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (37)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 36 (16 mg, 0.03 mmol) and Na2CO3 (3.6 mg, 0.03 mmol) in a 1:1 mixture of THF/H2O (4 mL) was added Fmoc-Cl (11 mg, 0.04 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 4 h; then, the solvent was removed in vacuo. The residue was partitioned between H2O (5 mL) and EtOAc (3 × 5 mL). The combined organic layers were dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (66% EtOAc in petroleum ether, Rf = 0.3) to afford compound 37 (15 mg, 61%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.89 min, m/z = 698.2 [M + H]+.

    (S)-2-(4-(4-(3-((((9H-Fluoren-9-yl)methoxy)carbonyl)amino)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetic Acid (38)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 37 (15 mg, 0.02 mmol) in DCM (2 mL) was added TFA (0.5 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated to give compound 38 (13.5 mg, 98%) as a yellow oil. This material was used in the next step without further purification. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.78 min, m/z = 642.1 [M + H]+.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-17-((S)-4-(4-(3-Aminoprop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-2-(tert-butyl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxy-N-(4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)pyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (5)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 38 (10 mg, 0.02 mmol), HATU (7.7 mg, 0.02 mmol), and DIEA (0.01 mL, 0.057 mmol) in DMF (3 mL) was added compound 31(59) (12 mg, 0.02 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 3 h and then diluted with DCM (15 mL). The resulting solution was washed with H2O (15 mL) and brine (20 mL), and the organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (10% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.4) to give the coupled product (not shown, 12 mg, 59%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.79 min, m/z = 1243.5 [M + H]+. A mixture of this product (12 mg, 0.01 mmol) and piperidine (1.0 mL, 0.03 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 20–45/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 5 (4.3 mg, 43%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.62 min, m/z = 1021.5 [M + H]+.

    tert-Butyl 2-((S)-4-(4-(3-((S)-2-((((9H-Fluoren-9-yl)methoxy)carbonyl)amino)-5-ureidopentanamido)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (39)

    To a 23 °C solution of Fmoc-l-Cit-OH (30 mg, 0.08 mmol) in DMF (10 mL) were added HATU (48 mg, 0.13 mmol) and DIEA (20 mg, 0.15 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 10 min; then, compound 36 (30 mg, 0.06 mmol) was added, and stirring was continued at that temperature for 12 h. The reaction mixture was partitioned between H2O (10 mL) and EtOAc (10 mL), and the organic layer was washed sequentially with H2O (2 × 20 mL) and brine (20 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (10% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.4) to afford compound 39 (45 mg, 78%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.89 min, m/z = 877.1 [M + Na]+.

    tert-Butyl 2-((S)-4-(4-(3-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (40)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 39 (45 mg, 0.05 mmol) in DMF (5 mL) was added piperidine (0.02 mL, 0.16 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then concentrated to dryness to give the deprotected amine (not shown, 33 mg, 99% yield) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.74 min, m/z = 655.1 [M + Na]+. To a solution of compound 33(60) (19 mg, 0.06 mmol) in DMF (6 mL) were added HATU (40 mg, 0.10 mmol) and DIEA (20 mg, 0.15 mmol) at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at that temperature for 10 min; then, the crude deprotected amine derived above from 39 (33 mg, 0.05 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then partitioned between H2O (10 mL) and EtOAc (10 mL). The organic layer was washed sequentially with H2O (2 × 20 mL) and brine (20 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (10% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.2) to afford compound 40 (30 mg, 58%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.83 min, m/z = 945.1 [M + Na]+.

    2-((S)-4-(4-(3-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetic Acid (41)

    A solution of compound 40 (30 mg, 0.03 mmol) in 1:1 TFA/DCM (6 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h. The reaction mixture was concentrated to give compound 41 (28 mg, 99%) as a yellow solid, which was used directly in the next step. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.601 min, m/z = 434.3 [M/2 + H]+.

    N-(5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)-N-((S)-1-((3-(4-((S)-6-((S)-16-((2S,4R)-4-hydroxy-2-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidine-1-carbonyl)-17,17-dimethyl-2,14-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaoctadecyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-4-yl)phenyl)prop-2-yn-1-yl)amino)-1-oxo-5-ureidopentan-2-yl)cyclobutane-1,1-dicarboxamide (5a)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 41 (28 mg, 0.03 mmol) in DMF (10 mL) were added HATU (24.6 mg, 0.06 mmol) and DIEA (12.5 mg, 0.10 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 10 min; then, compound 31(59) (20 mg, 0.03 mmol) was added and stirring was continued at that temperature for 12 h. The reaction was partitioned between H2O (30 mL) and EtOAc (30 mL), and the organic layer was washed sequentially with H2O (2 × 20 mL) and brine (20 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. Purification of the residue by prep-TLC (20% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.5) afforded compound 5a (21 mg, 43%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.78 min, m/z = 757.0 [M/2 + Na]+.

    tert-Butyl (S)-2-(4-(4-(3-(6-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)hexanamido)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetate (43)

    To a 23 °C solution of commercially available compound 42 (39 mg, 0.13 mmol) and DIEA (0.06 mL, 0.34 mmol) in DMF (5 mL) was added compound 36 (40 mg, 0.08 mmol). The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then concentrated and directly purified by prep-TLC (10% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.3) to give compound 43 (55 mg, 94%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.86 min, m/z = 691.1 [M + Na]+.

    (S)-2-(4-(4-(3-(6-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)hexanamido)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetic Acid (44)

    A 23 °C solution of compound 43 (55 mg, 0.08 mmol) in 1:3 TFA/DCM (4 mL) was stirred at that temperature for 30 min. The reaction mixture was then concentrated to give compound 44 (49 mg, 97%) as a colorless oil, which was used directly in the next step. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.80 min, m/z = 613.4 [M + H]+.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-(3-(6-(2,5-dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)hexanamido)prop-1-yn-1-yl)phenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxy-N-(4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)pyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (5b)

    To a solution of compound 44 (49 mg, 0.08 mmol) in DMF (5 mL) were added HATU (61 mg, 0.16 mmol) and DIEA (31 mg, 0.24 mmol) at 23 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 10 min, after which compound 31(59) (55 mg, 0.09 mmol) was added. The resulting solution was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then partitioned between H2O (30 mL) and EtOAc (30 mL). The organic layer was washed sequentially with H2O (2 × 20 mL) and brine (20 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by prep-TLC (10% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.2) to afford 5b (34 mg, 33%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.82 min, m/z = 1214.6 [M + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 11.04 (brs, 1H), 8.60 (s, 1H), 7.85 (brs, 1H), 7.44–7.41 (m, 1H), 7.30–7.25 (m, 6H), 7.19 (s, 2H), 6.59 (s, 2H), 5.87 (brs, 1H), 4.72 (t, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 4.61–4.59 (m, 2H), 4.46–4.38 (m, 2H), 4.25–4.16 (m, 3H), 4.09–4.02 (m, 1H), 3.62–3.51 (m, 12H), 3.43 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 3.38 (d, J = 8.8 Hz, 1H), 3.38–3.30 (m, 2H), 3.05–3.02 (m, 3H), 2.54 (s, 2H), 2.43 (s, 2H), 2.31 (s, 2H), 2.14 (t, J = 7.6 Hz, 2H), 1.61–1.49 (m, 5H), 1.41–1.37 (m, 12H), 1.32 (d, J = 6.4 Hz, 8H), 1.28–1.18 (m, 4H), 0.9 (s, 9H).

    tert-Butyl (2-Hydroxy-4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamate (46)

    Boc2O (1490 mg, 6.81 mmol) was added to a 23 °C solution of amine 45(51c,61) (1000 mg, 4.54 mmol) and Et3N (1.91 mL, 13.6 mmol) in THF (10 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h, at which point TLC analysis (50% EtOAc in petroleum ether Rf = 0.5) showed consumption of the starting material. The solvent was removed under reduced pressure, and the residue was purified by flash column chromatography on silica gel eluting with 0–45% EtOAc in petroleum ether to give compound 46 (710 mg, 48%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.72 min, m/z = 321.4 [M + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 9.22 (brs, 1H), 8.67 (s, 1H), 7.11 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 7.05 (s, 1H), 6.92 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 5.30 (br, 1H), 4.27 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 2.55 (s, 3H), 1.47 (s, 9H).

    Benzyl (2-(2-(((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)ethyl)(methyl)carbamate (47)

    DIAD (1260 mg, 6.24 mmol) was added slowly to a 0 °C solution of compound 46 (1000 mg, 3.12 mmol), Ph3P (1640 mg, 6.24 mmol), and benzyl N-(2-hydroxyethyl)-N-methyl-carbamate (980 mg, 4.68 mmol) in THF (30 mL). The reaction mixture was then warmed to 70 °C and stirred at that temperature for 16 h. After cooling to 23 °C, the mixture was concentrated in vacuo, and the residue was purified via flash chromatography on silica gel eluting with 0–50% EtOAc in petroleum ether to afford compound 47 (3.0 g, 64%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.91 min, m/z = 512.1 [M + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.67 (s, 1H), 7.36–7.33 (m, 6H), 7.00 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 6.86–6.81 (m, 1H), 5.31 (br, 0.5H), 5.15 (s, 2H), 4.96 (br, 0.5H), 4.27–4.25 (m, 2H), 4.15–4.10 (m, 2H), 3.75–3.72 (m, 3H), 3.07 (s, 3H), 2.51 (s, 3H), 1.40 (s, 9H).

    Benzyl (2-(2-(Aminomethyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)ethyl)(methyl)carbamate (48)

    HCl (16 mL, 4 M in EtOAc) was added to compound 47 (3000 mg, 5.86 mmol) at 23 °C, and the resulting mixture was stirred at that temperature for 1 h. The mixture was then filtered, and the collected solid was washed with EtOAc (2 × 5 mL) to give compound 48 (HCl salt, 1000 mg, 38%) as a white solid.

    Benzyl (2-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)ethyl)(methyl)carbamate (50)

    IEA (1.84 mL, 11.2 mmol) was added to a 23 °C solution of compound 49(56a) (700 mg, 2.03 mmol), HATU (1273 mg, 3.35 mmol), and compound 48 (HCl salt, 1000 mg, 2.23 mmol) in DMF (10 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 20–75/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 50 (900 mg, 53%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.870 min, m/z = 760.7 [M + Na]+.

    Benzyl (2-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-18-(tert-Butyl)-2,2-dimethyl-4,16-dioxo-3,8,11,14-tetraoxa-5,17-diazanonadecan-19-oyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)ethyl)(methyl)carbamate (51)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 50 (280 mg, 0.38 mmol) in HFIP (20 mL) was added trifluoroacetic acid (4 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated to give the Boc-deprotected amine (TFA salt, not shown, 241 mg, 100%) as a brown oil. To a 23 °C solution of compound 14 (241 mg, 0.38 mmol) in DMF (2.4 mL) were added HATU (158 mg, 0.41 mmol), the crude TFA salt derived from compound 50 (116 mg, 0.38 mmol), and DIEA (0.25 mL, 1.4 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 15 h and then partitioned between H2O (20 mL) and EtOAc (3 × 20). The combined organic layers were washed sequentially with H2O (3 × 15 mL) and brine (15), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel (0–5% MeOH in DCM) to give compound 51 (282 mg, 81%) as a yellow oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.85 min, m/z = 949.4 [M + Na]+.

    Benzyl (2-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)ethyl)(methyl)carbamate (52)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 51 (282 mg, 0.30 mmol) in HFIP (20 mL) was added trifluoroacetic acid (7.7 mL, 3.04 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated to give the Boc-deprotected amine (TFA salt, not shown, 251 mg, 100%) as a brown solid. This crude material was dissolved in DMF (2 mL), and compound 13 (196 mg, 1.52 mmol), HATU (1267 mg, 0.33 mmol), and DIEA (0.25 mL, 1.4 mmol) were sequentially added. The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 15 h and then partitioned between H2O (20 mL) and EtOAc (3 × 20 mL). The combined organic layers were washed sequentially with H2O (3 × 15 mL) and brine (15 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel (0–5% MeOH in DCM) to give compound 52 (120 mg, 33%) as a yellow oil.

    (2S,4R)-N-(2-(2-Aminoethoxy)-4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)-1-((S)-2-(tert-butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (6)

    To a solution of compound 52 (200 mg, 0.17 mmol) in DCM (5 mL) was added iodotrimethylsilane (165 mg, 0.83 mmol) at 23 °C. After stirring for 16 h at that temperature, the reaction was quenched by addition of aqueous HCl (2 M, 2 mL) and the resulting mixture was directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 20–50/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 6 (21 mg, 12%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.77 min, m/z = 1075.0 [M + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6): 9.00 (s, 2H), 8.56 (s, 1H), 8.64–8.45 (m, 5H), 8.29 (s, 2H), 7.52–7.40 (m, 7H), 7.04 (s, 2H), 7.00 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 4.56 (d, J = 9.6 Hz, 2H), 4.54–4.45 (m, 4H), 3.98 (s, 3H), 3.72–3.52 (m, 14H), 3.33–3.13 (m, 1H), 2.77 (d, J = 4.8 Hz, 1H), 2.69 (t, J = 5.2 Hz, 3H), 2.60 (s, 3H), 2.45 (s, 3H), 2.41 (s, 3H), 2.33 (s, 2H), 2.06 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 4H), 1.96–1.83 (m, 5H), 1.62 (s, 4H), 0.92 (s, 7H), 0.98–0.84 (m, 1H).

    4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl (2-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)ethyl)(methyl)carbamate (6a)

    DIEA (1.5 mg, 0.012 mmol) was added to a 23 °C solution of compound 6 (3.0 mg, 0.0028 mmol) and compound 53(57) (3.1 mg, 0.0030 mmol) in DMF (2 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 38–68/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 6a (2.2 mg, 46%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.84 min, m/z = 858.9 [M/2 + Na]+. High-resolution mass spectrometry (HRMS) (electrospray ionization (ESI)), m/z = 1670.66 [M + H]+.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-N-(2-(2-(6-(2,5-dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)-N-methylhexanamido)ethoxy)-4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (6b)

    DIEA (1.3 mg, 0.010 mmol) was added to a 23 °C solution of compound 6 (3.0 mg, 0.0028 mmol) and compound 42 (1.3 mg, 0.0028 mmol) in DMF (2 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 38–68/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 6b (2.4 mg, 68%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.85 min, m/z = 1291.7 [M + Na]+. HRMS (ESI): m/z = 1290.48 [M + Na]+.

    Benzyl 4-(((2-Nitrophenyl)sulfonyl)oxy)piperidine-1-carboxylate (55)

    Benzyl 4-hydroxypiperidine-1-carboxylate (2260 mg, 10.2 mmol) in DCM (10 mL) was added dropwise to a solution of 2-nitrobenzene-1-sulfonyl chloride (2000 mg, 8.5 mmol), Et3N (2150 mg, 21.3 mmol), and DMAP (52 mg, 0.43 mmol) in DCM (50 mL) at 0 °C. The reaction mixture was warmed to 23 °C and was stirred at that temperature for 12 h. The reaction solution was then concentrated under reduced pressure, and the residue was purified by flash chromatography on silica gel eluting with 0–50% EtOAc in petroleum ether to afford compound 55 (1300 mg, 36%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.89 min, m/z = 442.9 [M + Na]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.17 (d, J = 6.8 Hz, 1H), 7.85–7.77 (m, 3H), 7.37–7.32 (m, 5H), 5.13-5.06 (m, 3H), 3.69–3.64 (m, 2H), 3.56–3.49 (m, 2H), 1.92–1.90 (m, 4H).

    Benzyl 4-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)piperidine-1-carboxylate (56)

    A mixture of Cs2CO3 (596 mg, 1.83 mmol), compound 54(61,62) (500 mg, 0.91 mmol), and compound 55 (1150 mg, 2.74 mmol) in DMF (20 mL) was stirred at 50 °C for 13 h. The reaction solution was cooled to 23 °C and then partitioned between H2O (10 mL) and EtOAc (3 × 30 mL). The organic layers were combined, dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified via flash chromatography on silica gel eluting with 0–90% EtOAc in petroleum ether to give compound 56 (370 mg, 53%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.90 min, m/z = 786.1 [M + Na]+.

    Benzyl 4-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-Amino-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)piperidine-1-carboxylate (57)

    A solution of compound 56 (50 mg, 0.07 mmol) in 1:5 TFA/DCM (6 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h. The reaction mixture was concentrated to give compound 57 (TFA salt, 50 mg, 98%, yellow solid), and this material was used in the next step without additional purification. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.76 min, m/z = 664.1 [M + H]+.

    Benzyl 4-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-18-(tert-Butyl)-2,2-dimethyl-4,16-dioxo-3,8,11,14-tetraoxa-5,17-diazanonadecan-19-oyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)piperidine-1-carboxylate (58)

    A solution of compound 57 (150 mg, 0.23 mmol), compound 14 (76 mg, 0.25 mmol), HATU (172 mg, 0.45 mmol), and DIEA (0.07 mL, 0.45 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (3 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h. The reaction mixture was then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 31–61/0.01% NH4Cl in H2O) to afford compound 58 (160 mg, 74%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.89 min, m/z = 975.2 [M + Na]+.

    Benzyl 4-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)piperidine-1-carboxylate (59)

    A solution of compound 58 (150 mg, 0.16 mmol) in 1:3 TFA/DCM (4 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 30 min. The reaction mixture was then concentrated to give the crude Boc-deprotected amine (not shown, TFA salt, 130 mg, 97%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.78 min, m/z = 875.1 [M + Na]+. Separately, DIEA (0.07 mL, 0.40 mmol) was added to a 23 °C solution of compound 13 (67 mg, 0.17 mmol) and HATU (116 mg, 0.30 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (2 mL), and the resulting mixture was stirred at that temperature for 20 min. The crude Boc-deprotected amine obtained from 58 (TFA salt, 130 mg, 0.15 mmol) was then added, and stirring was continued at 23 °C for 2 h. The reaction was partitioned between H2O (20 mL) and EtOAc (3 × 20 mL), and the combined organic layers were washed with brine (2 × 20 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by flash chromatography (0–100% EtOAc in petroleum ether) to afford compound 59 (150 mg, 80%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.91 min, m/z = 1257.9 [M + Na]+.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxy-N-(4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)-2-(piperidin-4-yloxy)benzyl)pyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (7)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 59 in DCM (2 mL) was added iodotrimethylsilane (152 mg, 0.76 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 20 min and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 26–56/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford chimeric degrader 7 (21 mg, 13%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.79 min, m/z = 1101.2 [M + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6) 8.97 (s, 1H), 8.49–8.45 (m, 1H), 8.39 (s, 1H), 8.29–8.26 (m, 1H), 7.48–7.39 (m, 6H), 7.07 (s, 1H), 6.80 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 4.65–4.63 (s, 1H), 4.56 (d, J = 10.0 Hz, 1H), 4.50–4.46 (m, 2H), 4.35 (s, 1H), 4.32–4.21 (m, 1H), 3.97 (s, 1H), 3.75–3.60 (m, 2H), 3.58–3.54 (m, 8H), 3.40–3.22 (m, 9H), 3.11–2.91 (m, 2H), 2.81–2.71 (m, 2H), 2.62–2.51 (m, 4H), 2.43 (s, 3H), 2.40(s, 3H), 2.06–2.01 (m, 1H), 2.00–1.91 (m, 3H), 1.68–1.65 (m, 2H), 1.61 (s, 3H), 0.93 (s, 9H).

    4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl 4-(2-(((2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamido)methyl)-5-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)phenoxy)piperidine-1-carboxylate (7a)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 53 (8.5 mg, 0.01 mmol) and compound 7 (8.5 mg, 0.01 mmol) in DMF (5 mL) was added DIEA (0.01 mL, 0.03 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 12–47/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 7a (1.6 mg, 12%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.85 min, m/z = 850.0 [M/2 + H]+.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(tert-Butyl)-17-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)-4,16-dioxo-6,9,12-trioxa-3,15-diazaheptadecanoyl)-N-(2-((1-(6-(2,5-dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)hexanoyl)piperidin-4-yl)oxy)-4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)-4-hydroxypyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (7b)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 7 (22 mg, 0.02 mmol) and compound 42 (9.2 mg, 0.03 mmol) in DMF (10 mL) was added DIEA (7.7 mg, 0.06 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 3 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 38–68/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 7b (4.5 mg, 17%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.87 min, m/z = 1294.4 [M + H]+.

    tert-Butyl 2-(3,5-Bis(benzyloxy)phenethoxy)acetate (61)

    A solution of NaOH (28 g, 718 mmol) in H2O (180 mL) was added to a 23 °C solution of compound 60(63) (3.0 g, 8.97 mmol) in toluene (80 mL) followed by sequential addition of tert-butyl 2-bromoacetate (14 g, 72 mmol) and nBu4HSO4 (2.45 g, 7.18 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then partitioned between H2O (100 mL) and EtOAc (2 × 200 mL). The combined organic layers were dried over Na2SO4 and then concentrated. The residue was purified by silica gel column eluting with 0–10% EtOAc in petroleum ether to afford compound 61 (3000 mg, 64%) as a white solid. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.42–7.31 (m, 10H), 6.51–6.48 (m, 3H), 5.01 (s, 4H), 3.94 (s, 2H), 3.72 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 2.88 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 1.47 (s, 9H).

    tert-Butyl 2-(3,5-Dihydroxyphenethoxy)acetate (62)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 61 (3000 mg, 6.69 mmol) in MeOH (40 mL) was added 10% palladium on carbon (710 mg). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C under H2 (1 atm) for 16 h and then filtered. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure and the residue was purified by column chromatography eluting with 50% EtOAc in petroleum ether to afford compound 62 (1600 mg, 87%) as a colorless oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 6.26 (d, J = 2.0 Hz, 2H), 6.21 (d, J = 2 Hz, 1H), 3.96 (s, 2H), 3.69 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 2.77 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 1.46 (s, 9H).

    tert-Butyl 2-(3-(2-(((Benzyloxy)carbonyl)amino)ethoxy)-5-hydroxyphenethoxy)acetate (63)

    To a 23 °C solution of CbzNHC2CH2Br (770 mg, 2.98 mmol) and compound 62 (800 mg, 2.98 mmol) in MeCN (20 mL) were added K2CO3 (660 mg, 4.77 mmol) and KI (50 mg, 0.30 mmol). The mixture was warmed to 70 °C and stirred at that temperature for 12 h. After cooling to 23 °C, the reaction mixture was diluted with EtOAc (250 mL) and washed with H2O (3 × 50 mL). The organic layer was concentrated, and the residue was purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 25–75/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 63 (340 mg, 26%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.81 min, m/z = 468.0 [M + Na]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.36–7.33 (m, 5H), 6.35 (s, 2H), 6.24 (s, 1H), 5.21 (br, 1H), 5.11 (s, 2H), 4.01–3.99 (t, J = 4.8 Hz, 2H), 3.96 (s, 2H), 3.71 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 3.59–3.57 (m, 2H), 2.84 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 2H), 1.47 (s, 9H).

    tert-Butyl 2-(3-(2-(((Benzyloxy)carbonyl)amino)ethoxy)-5-(((trifluoromethyl)sulfonyl)oxy)phenethoxy)acetate (64)

    Pyridine (0.31 mL, 3.82 mmol) and trifluoromethanesulfonic anhydride (0.26 mL, 1.53 mmol) were added sequentially to a 23 °C solution of compound 63 (340 mg, 0.76 mmol) in DCM (10 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h, diluted with EtOAc (80 mL), and washed with saturated aqueous citric acid (3 × 30 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated to give crude compound 64 (440 mg, 100%). This material was used directly in the next step. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 1.14 min, m/z = 600.1 [M + Na]+.

    tert-Butyl 2-(3-(2-(((Benzyloxy)carbonyl)amino)ethoxy)-5-((tert-butoxycarbonyl)amino)phenethoxy)acetate (65)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 64 (440 mg, 0.76 mmol) and tert-butyl carbamate (446 mg, 3.81 mmol) in 1,4-dioxane (20 mL) were added XPhos (73 mg, 0.15 mmol), Cs2CO3 (745 mg, 2.29 mmol), and Pd(OAc)2 (17 mg, 0.08 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 100 °C for 16 h, cooled to 23 °C, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by flash chromatography (0–20% EtOAc in petroleum ether) to give compound 65 (180 mg, 43%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.92 min, m/z = 567.1 [M + Na]+.

    tert-Butyl (S)-2-(3-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-5-(2-(2-(4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)phenethoxy)acetate (66)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 65 (180 mg, 0.33 mmol) in THF (15 mL) was added 10% palladium on carbon (35 mg, 0.33 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C under H2 (15 psi) for 1 h and then filtered. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure to give the corresponding deprotected primary amine (not shown, 135 mg, 91% yield) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.66 min, m/z = 411 [M + H]+. This crude material was dissolved in DMF (10 mL) at 23 °C, and DIEA (0.23 mL, 1.32 mmol), compound 13 (158 mg, 0.39 mmol), and HATU (153 mg, 0.40 mmol) were sequentially added. The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash column chromatography (0–10% MeOH in DCM) to give compound 66 (200 mg, 73%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.90 min, m/z = 793.2 [M + Na]+.

    (S)-2-(3-Amino-5-(2-(2-(4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)phenethoxy)acetic Acid (67)

    A mixture of compound 66 (200 mg, 0.25 mmol) in 4.0 M HCl in EtOAc (2.0 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h. The mixture was then concentrated under reduced pressure to afford compound 67 (HCl salt, 169 mg, 100%) as a white solid. This material was used in the next step without additional purification.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(2-(3-Amino-5-(2-(2-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)phenethoxy)acetamido)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-4-hydroxy-N-(4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)pyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (8)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 68(56a) (227 mg, 0.53 mmol), compound 67 (HCl salt, 169 mg, 0.25 mmol), and HATU (104 mg, 0.28 mmol) in DMF (10 mL) was added DIEA (0.21 mL, 1.25 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then directly purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 31–51/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 8 (45 mg, 17%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.81 min, m/z = 1049.5 [M + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ ppm 8.69 (s, 1H), 7.62–7.56 (m, 1H) 7.40 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.32–7.26 (m, 6H), 7.11 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 6.74 (brs, 1H), 6.65 (brs, 1H), 6.53 (brs, 1H), 4.76–4.73 (m, 1H), 4.63–4.56 (m, 2H), 4.51–4.38 (m, 2H), 4.08–3.96 (m, 5H), 3.84–3.68 (m, 4H), 3.64–3.54 (m, 2H), 3.50–3.42 (m, 3H), 3.36–3.24 (m, 2H), 2.82 (brs, 2H), 2.65 (s, 2H), 2.50 (s, 6H), 2.42 (s, 6H), 2.26 (br, 1H), 0.95 (s, 9H).

    4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl (3-(2-(2-((S)-4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)-5-(2-(2-(((S)-1-((2S,4R)-4-hydroxy-2-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-1-yl)-3,3-dimethyl-1-oxobutan-2-yl)amino)-2-oxoethoxy)ethyl)phenyl)carbamate (8a)

    To a 23 °C mixture of triphosgene (14 mg, 0.05 mmol) and 4 Å molecular sieves in DCM (2 mL) was added a solution of compound 8 (50 mg, 0.05 mmol) and Et3N (15 mg, 0.14 mmol) in DCM (2 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 30 min and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was dissolved in DCM (5 mL) at 23 °C, and a solution of compound 20(57) (82 mg, 0.14 mmol) and Et3N (15 mg, 0.14 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 38–68/0.225% FA in H2O) to give compound 8a (5 mg, 6%) as a white solid. LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 3.93 min, m/z = 824.5 [M/2 + H]+. HRMS (ESI): m/z = 1645.64 [M + H]+.

    cis-Dimethyl-piperidine-3,5-dicarboxylate (70)

    To a solution of commercially available 69 (6.0 g, 31 mmol) in acetic acid (50 mL) at 23 °C was added 85% PtO2·H2O (700 mg). The resulting suspension was hydrogenated at 50 psi and 45 °C for 12 h. After cooling to 23 °C, the catalyst was removed by filtration through silica gel. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure to afford compound 70 (6.0 g, 97%) as a colorless oil. This material was used directly in the next step without further purification.

    cis-1-(tert-Butyl)-3,5-dimethyl-piperidine-1,3,5-tricarboxylate (71)

    To a solution of compound 70 (6.0 g, 30 mmol) in 4:1 THF/H2O (25 mL) at 23 °C were added NaHCO3 (10 g, 119 mmol) and Boc2O (9.75 g, 45 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then partitioned between H2O (15 mL) and EtOAc (3 × 15 mL). The combined organic layers were dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by column chromatography (5–30% EtOAc in petroleum ether) to afford compound 71 (7.2 g, 75%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.87 min, m/z = 324.0 [M + Na]+.

    cis-tert-Butyl 3,5-Bis(hydroxymethyl)piperidine-1-carboxylate (72)

    To a −78 °C solution of compound 71 (7.2 g, 24 mmol) in THF (40 mL) was added DIBAL-H (1 M in toluene, 96 mL, 96 mmol). The mixture was stirred at −78 °C for 2 h, warmed to −25 °C, quenched with MeOH (25 mL), and stirred for 5 min at that temperature. An aqueous solution of potassium sodium tartrate tetrahydrate (Rochelle salt; 60 mL, 20% w/w in H2O) was added, and stirring was continued for another 1 h at 23 °C. The mixture was extracted with EtOAc (2 × 15 mL), and the combined organic layers were washed with water (2 × 30 mL) and brine (2 × 30 mL), dried over Na2SO4, and filtered. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure, and the residue was purified by flash column chromatography (0–10% MeOH in DCM) to give compound 72 (2.7 g, 38%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.84 min, m/z = 268.0 [M + Na]+.

    cis-tert-Butyl 3-((2-Ethoxy-2-oxoethoxy)methyl)-5-(hydroxymethyl)piperidine-1-carboxylate (73)

    To a 0 °C solution of rhodium diacetate (0.45 g, 2.04 mmol) and compound 72 (2.5 g, 10.2 mmol) in DCM (40 mL) was added ethyl 2-diazoacetate (1.07 mL, 10.2 mmol). The mixture was warmed to 23 °C and was stirred for 12 h at that temperature. The reaction was quenched with H2O (10 mL), and the mixture was extracted with DCM (3 × 10 mL). The combined organic layers were washed with H2O (3 × 10 mL) and brine (3 × 10 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by column chromatography (0–1% MeOH in DCM) to afford compound 73 (racemic, 1.0 g, 30%) as a colorless oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.81 min, m/z = 354.1 [M + Na]+.

    cis-tert-Butyl 3-((2-(((Benzyloxy)carbonyl)amino)ethoxy)methyl)-5-((2-ethoxy-2-oxoethoxy)methyl)piperidine-1-carboxylate (75)

    A solution of compound 74(64) (800 mg, 4.53 mmol) in DCM (3 mL) was added dropwise to a −78 °C mixture of compound 73 (1000 mg, 3.02 mmol) and Sc(OTf)3 (149 mg, 0.30 mmol) in DCM (10 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred at −78 °C for 4 h and then maintained at 23 °C for 12 h. After concentrating the reaction solution under reduced pressure, the residue was purified by flash chromatography on silica gel eluting with 0–5% MeOH in DCM to give a partially pure product. This material was further purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 50–80%/10 mM NH4HCO3 in H2O) to afford compound 75 (racemic, 200 mg, 13%) as a brown oil. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.90 min, m/z = 409.0 [M – 100 + H]+.

    cis-tert-Butyl 3-((2-Aminoethoxy)methyl)-5-((2-ethoxy-2-oxoethoxy)methyl)piperidine-1-carboxylate (76)

    To a 23 °C suspension of 10% Pd on carbon (36 mg) in THF (10 mL) was added compound 75 (170 mg, 0.33 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C under H2 (15 psi) for 1 h and then filtered. The filter cake was washed with MeOH (3 × 10 mL), and the combined filtrate and washings were concentrated to afford compound 76 (racemic, 125 mg, 100%) as a yellow oil. This material was used in the next step without additional purification. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.71 min, m/z = 375.0 [M + H]+.

    tert-Butyl 3-((2-(2-((S)-4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)methyl)-5-((2-ethoxy-2-oxoethoxy)methyl)piperidine-1-carboxylate (77)

    To a 0 °C solution of compound 13 (161 mg, 0.40 mmol), HATU (190 mg, 0.50 mmol), and DIEA (0.17 mL, 1 mmol) in DMF (5 mL) was added compound 76 (125 mg, 0.33 mmol). The reaction mixture was warmed to 23 °C and was stirred at that temperature for 1 h. After concentrating the reaction solution under reduced pressure, the residue was purified by prep-TLC (5% MeOH in DCM, Rf = 0.3) to afford compound 77 (∼2:1 mix of cis-diastereomers, 240 mg, 92%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.92 min, m/z = 757.0 [M + H]+.

    2-((1-(tert-Butoxycarbonyl)-5-((2-(2-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)methyl)piperidin-3-yl)methoxy)acetic Acid (78)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 77 (180 mg, 0.24 mmol) in 5:1:1 THF/MeOH/H2O (7 mL) was added LiOH·H2O (50 mg, 1.19 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h and then partitioned between H2O (10 mL) and EtOAc (3 × 10 mL). The aqueous layer was acidified with citric acid to pH = 4, and the resulting mixture was extracted with EtOAc (3 × 10 mL). The combined organic layers were dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 25–55%/10 mM NH4HCO3 in H2O) to afford compound 78 (∼2:1 mix of cis-diastereomers, 100 mg, 58%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.84 min, m/z = 751.1 [M + Na]+.

    tert-Butyl 3-((2-(2-((S)-4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)methyl)-5-((2-(((S)-1-((2S,4R)-4-hydroxy-2-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-1-yl)-3,3-dimethyl-1-oxobutan-2-yl)amino)-2-oxoethoxy)methyl)piperidine-1-carboxylate (79)

    A solution of compound 78 (80 mg, 0.11 mmol), compound 68(56a) (71 mg, 0.16 mmol), DIEA (71 mg, 0.55 mmol), and HATU (50 mg, 0.13 mmol) in DMF (4 mL) was stirred at 50 °C for 12 h. The mixture was cooled to 23 °C and concentrated. The residue was purified by reverse-phase chromatography (MeCN 40–70%/10 mM NH4HCO3 in H2O) to afford compound 79 (∼2:1 mix of cis-diastereomers, 80 mg, 64%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.89 min, m/z = 1142.3 [M + H]+.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(2-((5-((2-(2-((S)-4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)methyl)piperidin-3-yl)methoxy)acetamido)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl)-4-hydroxy-N-(4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)pyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (9)

    A mixture of compound 79 (25 mg, 0.02 mmol) in 4 M HCl in EtOAc (9.8 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 1 h. The mixture was concentrated, and the residue was washed with EtOAc (2 × 10 mL) and DCM (2 × 10 mL) to afford compound 9 (HCl salt, ∼2:1 mix of cis-diastereomers, 20 mg, 85%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (10–80, AB, 7.0 min): RT = 3.23 min, m/z = 521.6 [M/2 + H]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, D2O) δ 9.56 (s, 1H), 7.43–7.38 (m, 4H), 7.36–7.33 (m, 4H), 4.53–4.46 (m, 3H), 4.38–4.37 (m, 2H), 4.05–3.96 (m, 2H), 3.90–3.87 (m, 1H), 3.77–3.75 (m, 1H), 3.59–3.57 (m, 3H), 3.49–3.32 (m, 9H), 2.69–2.65 (m, 4H), 2.46 (s, 3H), 2.33–1.88 (m, 10H), 1.67–1.63 (m, 1H), 1.52 (s, 3H), 1.19–1.13 (m, 1H), 0.88–0.86 (m, 9H).

    4-((S)-2-(1-((5-(2,5-Dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)pentyl)carbamoyl)cyclobutane-1-carboxamido)-5-ureidopentanamido)benzyl-3-((2-(2-((S)-4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)methyl)-5-((2-(((S)-1-((2S,4R)-4-hydroxy-2-((4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)carbamoyl)pyrrolidin-1-yl)-3,3-dimethyl-1-oxobutan-2-yl)amino)-2-oxoethoxy)methyl)piperidine-1-carboxylate (9a)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 53(56) (9.1 mg, 0.01 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (2 mL) were added compound 9 (8.9 mg, 0.01 mmol) and DEIA (5.3 mg, 0.04 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by sequential prep-HPLC runs (#1: MeCN 38–58%/10 mM NH4HCO3 in H2O; #2: MeCN 39–59/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 9a (∼2:1 mix of cis-diastereomers, 4.1 mg, 43%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.84 min, m/z = 820.0 [M/2 + H]+.

    (2S,4R)-1-((S)-2-(2-(5-((2-(2-((S)-4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamido)ethoxy)methyl)-1-(6-(2,5-dioxo-2,5-dihydro-1H-pyrrol-1-yl)hexanoyl)piperidin-3-yl)methoxy)acetamido)-3,3-dimethylbutanoyl-4-hydroxy-N-(4-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)benzyl)pyrrolidine-2-carboxamide (9b)

    To a 23 °C solution of commercially available compound 42 (6.4 mg, 0.02 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (2 mL) was added compound 9 (15 mg, 0.01 mmol) and DIEA (9.0 mg, 0.07 mmol). The resulting mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by prep-HPLC (MeCN 45–75/0.225% FA in H2O) to afford compound 9b (∼2:1 mix of cis-diastereomers, 4.0 mg, 23%) as a white solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT =0.85 min, m/z = 618.3 [M/2 + H]+.

    (S)-2-(4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)acetamide (80)

    To a 23 °C mixture of compound 13 (0.87 g, 2.11 mmol), NH4Cl (338 mg, 6.32 mmol), and HATU (1600 mg, 4.21 mmol) in DMF (20 mL) was added DIEA (1.74 mL, 10.5 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 2 h and then concentrated, and the residue was purified by flash column chromatography eluting with 0–5% MeOH in DCM to give compound 80 (0.84 g, 98%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.77 min, m/z = 421.9 [M + Na]+.

    (S)-2-(4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepin-6-yl)ethanimidothioic Acid (81)

    To a solution of compound 80 (840 mg, 2.10 mmol) in THF (50 mL) was added Lawesson’s reagent (1.70 g, 4.20 mmol) at 23 °C. The mixture was warmed to 40 °C and stirred at that temperature for 2 h. After cooling to 23 °C, the reaction solution was diluted with EtOAc (250 mL) and washed with H2O (3 × 50 mL) and brine (50 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash column chromatography eluting with 5–10% MeOH in DCM to give compound 81 (630 mg, 71%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.89 min, m/z = 416.0 [M + H]+.

    (S)-4-(4-Chlorophenyl)-2,3,9-trimethyl-6-(thiazol-2-ylmethyl)-6H-thieno[3,2-f][1,2,4]triazolo[4,3-a][1,4]diazepine (82)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 81 (630 mg, 1.51 mmol) and 2-bromo-1,1-diethoxyethane (448 mg, 2.27 mmol) in HOAc (5 mL) was added TsOH (26 mg, 0.15 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 90 °C for 1 h, cooled to 23 °C, and concentrated under reduced pressure. Purification of the residue by flash column chromatography eluting with 5–10% MeOH in DCM gave compound 82 (600 mg, 87%) as a yellow solid. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.85 min, m/z = 461.9 [M + Na]+.

    2-(3,5-Dibromophenyl)ethan-1-ol (84)

    To a 23 °C solution of 2-(3,5-dibromophenyl)acetic acid (83, 5.0 g, 17 mmol) in THF (75 mL) was added borane in THF (1.0 M, 51 mL, 51 mmol). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then quenched by addition of MeOH (10 mL). The resulting mixture was concentrated to dryness, and the residue was diluted with EtOAc (60 mL). The organic layer was washed with water (20 mL) and brine (3 × 20 mL). The organics were then dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated to give the crude product. This material was purified by flash column chromatography eluting with 0–30% EtOAc in petroleum ether to afford compound 84 (4.72 g, 99%) as an off-white solid. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CD3OD) δ 7.53 (s, 1H), 7.39 (m, 2H), 3.72 (t, J = 6.4 Hz, 2H), 2.76 (t, J = 6.4 Hz, 2H).

    tert-Butyl 2-(3,5-Dibromophenethoxy)acetate (85)

    A mixture of compound 84 (4.0 g, 14.3 mmol), tert-butyl 2-bromoacetate (22.3 g, 114 mmol), nBu4NHSO4 (3.88 g, 11.4 mmol), and NaOH (46 g, 1140 mmol) in toluene (80 mL) and H2O (228 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 3 h. The reaction mixture was extracted with MTBE (3 × 50 mL), and the combined organic layers were dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was purified by chromatography on silica eluting with 0–10% EtOAc in petroleum ether to give compound 85 (5.55 g, 98%) as a colorless oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CD3OD) δ 7.52 (s, 1H), 7.42 (s, 2H), 3.93 (s, 2H), 3.69 (t, J = 6.4 Hz, 2H), 2.84 (t, J = 6.4 Hz, 2H), 1.44 (s, 9H).

    2-(3,5-Dibromophenethoxy)acetic Acid (86)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 85 (4.5 g, 11.4 mmol) in DCM (180 mL) was added TFA (36 mL). The mixture was stirred at 23 °C for 16 h and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was dissolved in EtOAc (60 mL), and this solution was washed with water (3 × 20 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated to give the crude compound 86 (3.65 g, 95%) as a yellow oil. This material was used directly in the next step. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.54 (s, 1H), 7.32 (d, J = 1.6 Hz, 2H), 4.16 (s, 2H), 3.77 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 2H), 2.89 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 2H).

    2-(3,5-Dibromophenethoxy)ethan-1-ol (87)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 86 (5.30 g, 15.7 mmol) in THF (70 mL) was added borane dimethyl sulfide complex (10 M in Me2S, 4.7 mL, 47 mmol). The reaction solution was stirred at 23 °C for 12 h and then quenched by addition of MeOH (30 mL). The resulting mixture was concentrated under reduced pressure, and the residue was dissolved in EtOAc (90 mL). This solution was washed sequentially with saturated aqueous NaHCO3 (3 × 20 mL) and brine (3 × 30 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated to give the crude compound 87 (4.60 mg, 91%) as a yellow oil. This material was used in the next step without additional purification. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.53 (d, J = 2.0 Hz, 1H), 7.32 (d, J = 2.0 Hz, 2H), 3.74–3.67 (m, 4H), 3.56 (t, J = 4.8 Hz, 2H), 2.85 (t, J = 6.4 Hz, 2H).

    tert-Butyl (2-(3,5-Dibromophenethoxy)ethoxy)dimethylsilane (88)

    A mixture of crude compound 87 (4.60 g, 14.2 mmol), TBSCl (3.21 g, 21.3 mmol), and imidazole (2.90 g, 42.6 mmol) in DCM (50 mL) was stirred at 23 °C for 4 h. The reaction solution was then partitioned between H2O (30 mL) and DCM (3 × 30 mL). The combined organic layers were washed with brine (3 × 30 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by flash column chromatography eluting with 0–5% EtOAc in petroleum ether to give compound 88 (5.20 g, 84%) as a yellow oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CD3OD) δ 7.48 (s, 1H), 7.37 (s, 2H), 3.71–3.63 (m, 4H), 3.45 (t, J = 5.2 Hz, 2H), 2.79 (t, J = 6.0 Hz, 2H), 0.84 (s, 9H), 0.0 (s, 6H).

    tert-Butyl (E)-3-(3-Bromo-5-(2-(2-((tert-butyldimethylsilyl)oxy)ethoxy)ethyl)phenyl)acrylate (89)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 88 (1.38 g, 3.15 mmol) in DMF (20 mL) were added nBu4NBr (1.02 mg, 3.15 mmol), tert-butyl acrylate (605 mg, 4.72 mmol), NaHCO3 (1.06 mg, 12.6 mmol), and Pd(OAc)2 (71 mg, 0.31 mmol). The resulting mixture was heated to 105 °C and was stirred at that temperature for 24 h. After cooling to 23 °C, the reaction mixture was filtered, and the filtrate was diluted with EtOAc (90 mL). This solution was washed with H2O (30 mL) and brine (3 × 30 mL) and then dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. The residue was to give crude, which was purified by column chromatography (0–10% EtOAc in petroleum ether) to give compound 89 (1.23 g, 81%) as a light-yellow oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CD3OD) δ 7.52 (s, 1H), 7.44 (d, J = 16 Hz, 1H), 7.40 (s, 1H), 7.38 (s, 1H), 6.48 (d, J = 16 Hz, 1H), 3.71–3.65 (m, 4H), 3.46 (t, J = 4.8 Hz, 2H), 2.83 (t, J = 6.4 Hz, 2H), 1.49 (s, 9H), 0.84 (s, 9H), 0.0 (s, 6H).

    tert-Butyl (E)-3-(3-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-5-(2-(2-((tert-butyldimethylsilyl)oxy)ethoxy)ethyl)phenyl)acrylate (90)

    tert-Butyl carbamate (445 mg, 3.8 mmol), Cs2CO3 (1.65 g, 5.07 mmol), Xphos (120 mg, 0.25 mmol), and Pd(OAc)2 (29 mg, 0.13 mmol) were sequentially added to a solution of compound 89 (1.23 mg, 2.53 mmol) in 1,4-dioxane (20 mL) at 23 °C. The mixture was then heated to 100 °C and was stirred at that temperature for 16 h. After cooling to 23 °C, the reaction solution was filtered, and the filtrate was diluted with EtOAc (90 mL). This solution was washed with H2O (30 mL) and brine (3 × 30 mL), dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and then concentrated. The residue was purified by column chromatography eluting with 0–17% EtOAc in petroleum ether to give compound 90 (1.18 g, 89%) as a yellow oil. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CD3OD) δ 7.45 (d, J = 16 Hz, 1H), 7.43 (s, 1H), 7.30 (s, 1H), 6.33 (s, J = 16 Hz, 1H), 3.71–3.65 (m, 4H), 3.47 (t, J = 4.8 Hz, 2H), 2.80 (m, J = 4.8 Hz, 2H), 1.49 (s, 18H), 0.85 (s, 9H), 0.00 (s, 6H).

    tert-Butyl 3-(3-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-5-(2-(2-hydroxyethoxy)ethyl)phenyl)propanoate (91)

    To a 23 °C solution of compound 90 (2.00 g, 3.83 mmol) in MeOH (20 mL) was added 10% palladium on carbon (408 mg). The mixture was hydrogenated at 50 °C under H2 (50 psi) for 16 h and then cooled to 23 °C and filtered. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure to afford the crude compound 91 (1.75 g, >100%) as a colorless oil. This material was used in the next step without additional purification. LCMS (5–95, AB, 1.5 min): RT = 0.78 min, m/z = 432.1 [M + Na]+. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CD3OD) δ 7.12 (s, 2H), 6.74 (s, 1H), 3.68–3.63 (m, 4H), 3.53–3.51 (m, 2H), 2.80 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 4H), 2.50 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 1.50 (s, 9H), 1.39 (s, 9H).

    tert-Butyl 3-(3-((tert-Butoxycarbonyl)amino)-5-(2-(2-(prop-2-yn-1-yloxy)ethoxy)ethyl)phenyl)propanoate (92)

    tert-BuONa (440 mg, 4.57 mmol) was added to a solution of crude compound 91 (1.56 g, 3.81 mmol) in THF (20 mL) at 0 °C.
